bio: I love making vegetables insanely delicious. 🍋 Author of Love & Lemons - the cookbook & veggie food blog.

list.comment: The best eating holiday of the year might the over but ’tis still the season for a festive farro salad decorated with “ornaments” of pomegranates :) ❤️🎄The roasted halloumi (that you can’t really see here) really takes this one over the top! (Recipe link in profile) https://www.loveandlemons.com/fall-farro-salad-with-roasted-halloumi-pomegranates/

It started snowing on Sunday night and I haven’t left the house since :) 😬❄️ Luckily, I have quite the stash of soups in my freezer, including this Creamy Cauliflower Celery Root soup with mushrooms, leeks & thyme. (New on the blog - recipe link in profile). 💛#vegan https://www.loveandlemons.com/creamy-celery-root-cauliflower-soup/

So flattered to be included in Clarkson Potter’s @pottergift Holiday Gift Guide along with some of my all-time favorite authors! Click the link in my profile to see the rest of the group - there are some great gifts on the list including our cookbook and meal planner, The Love & Lemons Meal Record & Market List. 💛💛💛 http://crownpublishing.com/clarkson-potter-holiday-gift-guide-cookbooks-cocktails

It’s all squash all the time around here! Of everything I’ve made this season, THIS roasted delicata recipe might be my favorite. It has a combination of sweet roasted squash, tangy cabbage, a pop of sweet currants, and a base of creamy, lightly funky, blue cheese sauce. A real looker at the table! 💛💛 (Recipe link in profile) https://www.loveandlemons.com/roasted-delicata-squash-w-red-cabbage-blue-cheese/

Roasted Acorn Squash with Chickpeas & Chimichurri - a yummy holiday vegetarian main course or a side dish for anyone who just love vegetables! Cumin-cinnamon spiced chickpeas are topped with tangy chimichurri. A bit of an unexpected flavor combo for Thanksgiving, but my whole family loved it when I served it at my T-day test day! 💛💛 (Recipe link in profile). https://www.loveandlemons.com/acorn-squash-chickpeas-chimichurri/

Happy Thanksgiving & happy leftovers-making! Hope you have some leftover veggies to make these 🥪🧡🍎Butternut Apple, Cranberry Sandwiches! (Recipe link in profile) https://www.loveandlemons.com/butternut-apple-cranberry-sandwich/

Get a group together and serve this Fennel & Winter Green Pasta! 💚💚 It’s a one-pot recipe (aside from boiling the pasta) that you can bring straight from the stove to the table, especially if you make it in a super pretty @lecreuset braiser. I’m obsessed with this Matte Cotton color and the way it makes the yummy winter greens really pop! For holiday entertaining, I like to keep my table decor simple so that the food stands out - neutral fabrics, plates, and mismatched silverware (because I don’t actually own four forks that match). #gatherwithcolor #sponsored

recipe:
2 tablespoons olive oil, more for drizzling
3 shallots, thinly sliced
1 large fennel bulb, thinly sliced
3 garlic cloves, sliced
¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes
¼ cup chopped sage
12-ounces short-cut pasta
¼ cup dry white wine
8 cups torn kale leaves
8 oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
¼ cup chopped walnuts, toasted
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
Freshly grated pecorino cheese

Heat the oil in a large braiser or skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots, fennel, garlic, red pepper flakes, sage, ½ teaspoon salt, and freshly ground black pepper and cook until the fennel is tender, about 8 minutes.

Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta until al dente.
To the fennel mixture, add the white wine and let it reduce for 30 seconds. Reduce the heat to low, add the kale and toss until just wilted. Use a slotted spoon to scoop the cooked pasta into the braiser/skillet. Add the sun-dried tomatoes, walnuts, lemon juice and toss.
Season to taste and serve with drizzles of olive oil and grated pecorino cheese.

Serves 4
https://bit.ly/2TBZ3yU

My spin on a classic wild rice soup: This White Bean Soup with Kale & Wild Rice is great as a Thanksgiving starter or for a cozy Monday night dinner :). The lightly creamy base is made with almond milk, blended cashews, and miso paste. It’s packed with veggies, herbs, and a squeeze of lemon for a bit of brightness. And speaking of bright things - the pop of Marseille blue on my new @lecreuset Dutch oven makes me so happy to get cooking this holiday season! It’s also the best way to cook this one-pot soup since it maintains heat so well. 💙💙(Recipe link in profile) #gatherwithcolor #sponsored https://www.loveandlemons.com/white-bean-soup-kale-wild-rice/

I love love love roasted Brussels sprouts at this time of year, but I just couldn’t settle on one flavor combo… so I thought - Brussels Sprouts Many Ways! You can choose! Pick the one you like and make it for an easy holiday side dish. All 4 recipes are in my profile link. 💚 https://www.loveandlemons.com/roasted-brussels-sprouts-many-ways/

If you need a cozy Thanksgiving drink, make these Maple Hot Toddy cocktails with @BlackBoxSpirits Whiskey… or better yet, set up the ingredients and have your guests make their own! The tap makes it easy to use and fun to entertain with. 🍁🥃 Here’s the recipe:

serves 2:
1 cup steeped ginger tea
3 ounces #BlackBoxSpirits Whiskey
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
2 teaspoons maple syrup
for garnish: orange or apple slices, pomegranates, fresh thyme
Stir and serve!
For 21+ | #BlackBoxSpiritsPartner

I posted a bunch of my favorite Thanksgiving recipes on the blog today including this Shredded Brussels Sprout Salad that’s my go-to recipe when I’m assigned to bring a salad to a holiday dinner. 💚💚 It packs a punch of flavor even though the ingredient list is minimal! (Link in profile). It’s also in the cookbook on page 68. https://www.loveandlemons.com/favorite-vegetarian-thanksgiving-recipes/
